descriptionlist.description: Did you know that the cellular data usage reported by iOS is inaccurate,</br> and that Apple has been hiding some important details from you?

Cellular data used by Apple's internal system apps and processes is hidden</br> by default...but not for long once DCU is installed! In addition to fully</br> revealing cellular data usage details, DCU also enables the ability to manage</br> cell data access to select system apps, processes & daemons - giving you</br> even <u>more</u> control over how your data is used!
DetailedCellularUsage is compatible with all cellular-capable iPhone's</br> & iPad's running iOS 8.x through 10.2 (tested on iOS 8.4, 9.0.2, 9.3.3,</br> 9.3.5, 10.1.1 & 10.2).

DCU is enabled by default after installation. You'll find a switch
to enable/disable DCU on the default iOS Cellular Data page in the Settings app
(bottom of the page). Enabling or disabling DCU will automatically trigger the
cellular usage report to refresh.
No respring is required after installation. Please contact me if you have any</br> questions or need any additional information or support.
